channel.title: Nullpointer
channel.description:
Hello,
My server starts fine but when a player does a certain thing it starts errors. (PI 317) (Hybrid PvP Source)

server.event.EventManager.run(EventManager.java:101) [5/25/11 2:42 PM]: at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:662) [/code]
Non stop spamming of those, I check the lines where the error is and they are as follows. [b] EventContainer.java[/b] [code]public void execute() { this.lastRun = System.currentTimeMillis(); this.event.execute(this);[/code] [b]EventManager.java[/b] [code]try { container.execute(); } catch (Exception e){e.printStackTrace();}[/code] [b]CombatAssistant.java[/b] [code]public void execute(EventContainer b) {[/code]
Any help or suggestions would be great. Server operates fine, at least from what I see. But I get spamming of those errors 24/7.

item.title: Nullpointer
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:396548”]that java.lang.nullpointexecption thing… you cant really get rid of… on my client cmd. it never goes away… idk how to fix this but look in server.java and look through the files… try finding ones that say System.out.println MESSAGE HERE
Those are the things that show up in your server’s cmd.[/quote][quote=“InsidiaX, post:3, topic:396548”]Gosh i have this too >.< Ill just go remove the system out then, thanks[/quote]

Just because you remove the “System.out” doesn’t mean the error will stop. It just means that it wont tell you there’s an error. Instead of trying to “hide” it, how about trying to fix the problem.

Post your CombatAssistant and EventManager classes.

Read full topic

item.title: Nullpointer
item.dc:creator: @InsidiaX InsidiaX
item.description:
@InsidiaX wrote:

Gosh i have this too >.< Ill just go remove the system out then, thanks

Read full topic

item.title: Nullpointer
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

that java.lang.nullpointexecption thing… you cant really get rid of… on my client cmd. it never goes away… idk how to fix this but look in server.java and look through the files… try finding ones that say System.out.println MESSAGE HERE
Those are the things that show up in your server’s cmd.

Read full topic
